intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. legnodes, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its subspecies status reflects subtle differences in morphology and distribution compared to other Hieracium species.
